intro: Wallichia arborea, commonly known as the tree of heaven, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to 10 meters in height. Wallichia arborea is also known for its ability to thrive in various soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
